position: Analyst / Senior Analyst - Amex Offers Marketing

location.country: New York, New York, United States

description:
The US Customer Marketing Team, within the US Consumer & Global Premium Services group, strives to deliver marketing on behalf of the enterprise that makes American Express essential to our Card Members. Responsibilities include end to end marketing strategy and execution across the Card Member lifecycle including early tenure, loyalty and retention. The team includes a group of talented, passionate marketers who rally to leverage the customer as a platform for growth ─ driving margin & share of wallet, along with deepening the loyalty & satisfaction among our customer base.

 

This role sits on the Member Value team, which has the mission to deliver relevant, personalized, and meaningful value to Card Members, creating the most efficient path to connect buyers and sellers. In doing so, we seek to grow share of wallet and profitably increase the value of savings and rewards the Card Member redeems while paying with their Card. One of the exciting ways we connect buyers and sellers are Amex Offers, which we promote to Card Members to incentivize and reward card usage. (Visit www.amexoffers.com for more info.)

 

The Analyst / Senior Analyst will lead our Amex Offers Card Member marketing execution.  You will be responsible for deploying and advancing the strategy to inspire more Card Members to redeem more Amex Offers, more frequently. You will execute marketing across a variety of channels, including email, paid media, websites, Amex online account and Mobile App. You will also help expand and innovate our channel heat map.

 

This role is ideal for you if you are a customer-centric, collaborative, data-driven marketer that enjoys a good challenge and is eager to make a big impact on the business.

 

Responsibilities

  • Help evolve the Amex Offer Card Member Marketing Strategy, to inspire Card Members to enroll in and redeem offers.
  • Lead the end to end execution of campaigns across a variety of channels, with a focus on email, paid media, websites, Amex online account and Mobile App. Includes engaging with creative agencies and internal teams to develop high impact marketing assets, defining segmentation and targeting, following internal processes to compliantly bring campaigns to market, measuring results, and more.
  • Manage the www.amexoffers.com website and grow its impact.
  • Define and continually advance the marketing claims used to promote Amex Offers.
  • Continually advance our strategy and performance by expanding to new channels, innovating our tactics, and applying a test & learn approach.
  • Collaborate closely with colleagues across the Enterprise, including other marketers in US Customer Marketing, as well as with Global Merchant & Network Services (GMNS), Analytics Teams, the Amex Offers Product, Platforms, Execution and Email capabilities teams.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 1-2 years of digital marketing execution experience.
  • Track record of driving measurable results through creative, customer-centric marketing.
  • Strong project management skills with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize effectively.
  • Collaborative mindset, and the ability to partner effectively across band levels.
  • Excellent analytic skills, with the ability to leverage data to make informed decisions, and translate insights into winning strategies.
  • Proactive self-starter with the ability to take initiative, adapt well to change, and problem-solve independently.
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills.
  • Bachelor's Degree Required 
 

Why American Express

Talk to our people and you’ll find out what we’re all about. Open, creative, risk-taking, collaborative and innovative are just some of the expressions you’ll hear. It’s our culture that makes American Express an outstanding place to work, and a big part of why we regularly win best workplace awards all over the world. If you’re ready to take on a challenge and make an impact, you owe it to yourself to launch or grow your career here.

 

Additional Details:

Ongoing Workplace Flexibility: Position will currently be work-from-home due to COVID-19. American Express is committed to the well-being of its colleagues and to creating a safe work environment; colleagues will continue to work remotely until a return to the office can be safely accomplished.

Location(s): New York, New York

 

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

 

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

position: Campus Recruitment - 2022 Industrial Engineer Summer Internship

location.country: Phoenix, Arizona, United States • Sunrise, Florida, United States

description:
About AMEX

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible— and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.

Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.

 

Global Services Group offers a great pathway into Amex to build knowledge and experience about operations and leadership skills – including servicing, back office, Credit & Collections, card member acquisition and fraud detection.

 

Business Unit/Role Specific Info

Our IEs  act as internal business consultants to support our servicing and operations business groups.  Our primary goals are to enable superior customer experiences while reducing costs, by applying thought leadership and innovation to identify process improvement opportunities. You will be leading and supporting efforts to collect data, analyze for insights, develop proposals & recommendations for senior leadership, and deploy improvements to our systems & processes.  Projects will give exposure to multiple different business groups across the enterprise, coordinating with Technologies, Finance, Risk, Operations, Marketing, Brand, external vendors, and many more.

 

•         Directly lead projects & make a real world impact on our business & Card Members.

•         Gain experience with & create world class strategies, systems, and processes.

•         Leverage your statistical manufacturing tools and consulting techniques in the finance  industry.

•         Work as a team member in a large engineering organization of IEs, Analysts, & Project Managers – dedicated to helping improve business processes & drive optimization.

•         Experience diversified opportunities at our Phoenix & Florida service centers, including diverse career growth opportunities horizontally and vertically within the organization.

•         Competitive compensation package for internships – with summer relocation support .

 

Skills/Experience

•         Ability to clearly and consistently communicate orally & in writing with superiors & peers.

•         Adept at root cause and quantitative analysis using analytical skills.

•         Understanding of continuous process improvement & problem solving methodologies.

•         Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work independently or in teams.

•         Results driven with the ability to manage projects & initiatives to completion.

•         Demonstrated ability to drive project implementation working with diverse customer groups.

•         Knowledge & exposure using common IE software (such as Excel, SQL, etc).

•         Knowledge, exposure, or expertise in multiple IE topics, such as the following :

continuous improvement • complex problem solving • cost benefit analysis • Six Sigma • lean • project management • statistics • operations research • • forecasting • quality control / statistical process control • work/motion study • design of experiments • process or value stream mapping • etc.

Requirements/Qualifications

•            Currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelor’s or Graduate degree program in one of the below areas or similar:

•            Industrial, Manufacturing, Systems, or Operations Engineering

•            Informatics

•            Information Technology/Systems

•            Supply Chain Management

•            Engineering Management

•            Industrial Distribution

•            Business Data Analytics

•            Statistics

•            Students must have a graduation date between December 2022 and June 2023

 

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law.

Apply now!
